alert.note: Alert for Furnas; Gosper; Harlan; Phelps (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 09 at 8:10AM CDT until May 09 at 8:45AM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 AM CDT FOR PHELPS...GOSPER...FURNAS AND HARLAN COUNTIES... At 810 AM CDT, a cluster of severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Bertrand to near Edison to near Hendley, moving east at 35 mph. The most intense part of the cluster is near Arapahoe. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. These severe storms will be near... Bertrand around 815 AM CDT. Loomis around 820 AM CDT. Oxford around 825 AM CDT. Stamford and Atlanta around 840 AM CDT. Orleans around 850 AM CDT. Ragan around 855 AM CDT. Alma and Huntley around 900 AM CDT. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
